item.title: [ March 31, 2024] CFP for publication or other deadline: null
item.description:
Publication Name: Journal Religions - Special Issue: Aquinas and the Sciences: Exploring the Past, Present, and Future
Dear Colleagues,
This Special Issue explores how Thomas Aquinas and the Thomists from different ages related their thought to the natural and cognitive sciences, both from a systematic and an historical perspective. What can contemporary theology, philosophy, and science and religion, as well as the history of these disciplines, gain from an engagement with the thought of Thomas Aquinas and his appropriation and integration of, and perspectives on, the natural and cognitive sciences? Additionally, how did Thomists in later centuries live up to this challenge? What is the status quo of Aquinas scholarship and Thomistic contributions on science and theology, or more recently science-engaged theology, today? Contributions to historical and systematic scholarship are welcome. The subject matter of the submitted work may pertain to a broad spectrum of disciplines, including history, philosophy, theology, religious studies, science-engaged theology, and science and religion.
Dr. Simon Maria Kopf
Dr. Ignacio Silva
Guest Editors

item.title: [ November 16, 2023 - November 17, 2023] Conference or similar: Phenomenology, Reality and Essences (Online)

div.div: Arc: The Journal of the School of Religious Studies, McGill University

div.p: Arc: Journal of the School of Religious Studies

The editors of Arc: Journal of the School of Religious Studies are pleased to announce an open call for book reviews for the forthcoming volume (Vol. 51). We welcome submissions in all areas within the study of religion, including:

Arc is an interdisciplinary, refereed journal published annually by the School of Religious Studies, McGill University. The journal combines the talents of professors and graduate students in offering space for scholarly discussions on various aspects of the academic study of religion, including method and theory in the study of religion. Arc encourages submissions from diverse religious traditions and perspectives.

The submission deadline for Volume 51 is December 1st, 2023. Book reviews should not exceed 1,500 words. For detailed submission guidelines, please consult the “Submission” section on the journal website (https://arcjournal.library.mcgill.ca/about/submissions). All electronic correspondence should be sent to the editors at the following email address: arc.relgstud@mcgill.ca.

div.div: Institute of Language Studies and Research

div.p: Institute of Language Studies and Research (ILSR), Kolkata Journal

Institute of Language Studies and Research (ILSR), an institute under the Department of Higher Education, Government of West Bengal, functions as a nodal centre for research, documentation of language and culture-related materials, translation studies, and training in critical thinking, cultural and linguistic interaction.

We are thrilled to announce that the Institute of Language Studies and Research (ILSR) Kolkata, is going to launch its own bilingual journal by the end of this year. For the inaugural edition, we cordially invite you to submit your initial proposal. We welcome researchers, and Faculty members from their respective fields to contribute in this inaugural issue of the journal on the theme of “Critical Ramblings”. Look for a seminal work/book in the field of Humanities and Social Sciences that had a path breaking impact on that field of study. Contributors can think of a pioneering book that acted as a trend setter in the domain of literary and cultural studies, linguistic studies, critical theory, history of society and performance studies, etc. A substantial contribution that identifies such book/work as mentioned and deploys a close and contemporary critical-hermeneutical approach in revisiting that book/work is welcome. You are required to submit an abstract of not more than 300 words by 30th October 2023. The Selection of abstracts will be declared by 10th November, 2023.
Abstracts for potential contribution on a seminal work are especially invited for the following areas of research –
Areas of research are limited to South Asian Studies only
Deadline for the Submission of Abstracts – 30th October 2023 Intimation of Accepted abstracts – 10th November 2023 Deadline for the Full paper Submission – 30th November 2023
Guidelines for Abstract and paper submission:

We invite abstracts (max 300 words) in English or Bengali along with a biographical note (max 100 words). Abstracts should be sent via e-mail ONLY to ilsrjournal@gmail.com. Full length papers (of abstracts that are accepted) should be between 3000-4000 words. Selected academic papers will be published in the special inaugural journal issue of ILSR.
Font – Times New Roman (12) or T ℓ

description.p: Welcome to the Religious Studies Project Opportunities Digest! This week you will find 16 new job opportunities, 3 fellowships, 1 grant, 2 calls for papers, 2 conferences/speakers, and 3 other events/submissions.

Everyone at RSP says thank you to all who have generously supported the RSP through our Patreon and PayPal donation options! Our goal is to have 100 patrons (currently at 42!) to support all of our upcoming developments. Please visit our donations page for information on how you can sign up for a regular subscription, leave a one-off donation, advertise with us, or use our Amazon links.

item.title: [ November 23, 2023 - February 8, 2024] Conference or similar: Realismus und Idealismus heute IV
item.description:
Venue: Poppelsdofer Alle 28
Das "Realismus und Idealismus heute" Kolloquium ist eine Reihe von Vorlesungen und Workshops im Themenbereich des Realismus und Idealismus, in welchen sowohl historische als auch systematische Forschung aus diesem Themenbereich vorgestellt wird. Das Kolloquium ist öffentlich und alle Interessierten sind, unabhangig von ihrem akademischen Hintergrund, dazu eingeladen am Kolloquium teilzunehmen.
The "Realismus und Idealismus heute" colloquium is a series of lectures and workshops in the field of realism and idealism, in which both historical and systematic research in this field is presented. The colloquium is open to the public and all interested parties are invited to participate in the colloquium, regardless of their academic background.
Uhrzeit der Vorträge /Time of the lectures : 18:15-19:45
Uhrzeit der Workshops/ Time of the workshops: 14:15-17:45
23.11.23 | Marc Thiele (Bonn)
Idealistische Konzeptionen des Raumes und der Zeit
30.11.23 | Giuliano Infantino (Stuttgart)
Die Einheit des Denkens in Hegels Wissenschaft der Logik
07.12.23 | Anna Oswald (Cambridge)
Natur, Freiheit und Gnade
14.12.23 | Marco Seikel (Göttingen)
Begriff und Realität bei Hegel
21.12.23 | Fridolin Neumann (Warwick)
Heidegger über Kant und das synthetische Selbst
11.01.24 | Victor Portugal (Leuven)
Die Krisis des Realismus und der Anspruch auf Universalität: Eine phänomenologische Perspektive
18.01.24 | Eric Lam (Bonn)
Fichtes transzendentaler Konstitutivismus und Moralbegründung
25.01.24 | Edwin Kaack (Bonn)
Das Sichverstehen vom Bilde als Bild: Fichte über das Begreifen des Unbegreifbaren
01.02.24 | Georg Spoo (Freiburg)
Kritik der Transzendentalphilosophie
02.02.24 | Georg Spoo (Freiburg)
Workshop: Kants Idealismuskritik (14 – 18 Uhr c.t.)
08.02.24 | Marvin Tritschler (Stuttgart)
Workshop: Geistige Zeit und die Tätigkeit des Denkens (14 – 18 Uhr c.t.)

item.title: [ November 16, 2023] Conference or similar: Neo-Thomism and Evolution / Neo-Tomismo y Evolución
item.description:
Venue: Universidad Austral, Cerrito 1250
All times are in Buenos Aires times (GMT-3)
A Zoom link will be provided upon registration
Morning lectures will be in English, while afternoon lectures will be in Spanish

description.p:
In this release, besides adding some initial support for OpenID Connect, the focus has been on increasing the quality rather than adding new features (which will have more focus again in the next release).
This version 1.22.x is also the last to support PHP 7.2 before requiring PHP 7.4+.

ul.li: Add support for OpenID Connect (only in our Debian-based Docker image for x86_64, not Alpine, and not ARM) through libapache2-mod-auth-openidc. See our documentation
Improve scaling with many feeds and long processes, reduce database locks
Improve themes Origine (also with automatic dark mode), Nord, etc.
Docker default image updated to Debian 12 Bookworm with PHP 8.2
Increase our code base from PHPStan level 5 to level 7

description.p: This release has been made by several contributors: @Alkarex, @Alwaysin, @ColonelMoutarde, @Exerra, @FromTheMoon85, @LleanaRuv, @Marjani, @NaeiKinDus, @Rufubi, @V-E-O, @aaronschif, @acbgbca, @aledeg, @andris155, @becdetat, @belidzs, @kemayo, @kgraefe, @marienfressinaud, @math-GH, @msdlr, @obrenckle, @otaconix, @robertdahlem, @sad270, @samc1213, @squaregoldfish, @vrachnis, @witchcraze, @yubiuser, @zhaofengli
